column5: Make it easy for contributors to setup
examples for student materials
They provide different mechanisms including docker-compose and docker to run their applicatoin
use docker-compose `` to bring up […] container''

To simplify the creation and the stop of images. A good example is shown in a commit https://github.com/lsu-ub-uu/cora-therest/commit/a5e6af650710a6b082f060ab759fe13bd8f1ab42#diff-423deb13b7c401b1a7f41ee91c77f722e11d2f317d6a66b546524e8a04cc8b03
add docker compose for testing
REMOVED Compose file
REMOVED
"A docker-compose.yml is also included, configured for quick testing."
"Move to Docker compose for better reproducability". Instead of runing this command: "docker build -t lambci/lambci -f ../Dockerfile docker", you run just this one " docker-compose build"

Simplifying the construction of docker. Instead of executing this command "docker run --rm --label=jekyll -v "$(pwd)":/srv/jekyll  -it -p 4000:4000 jekyll/jekyll jekyll --config _config.dev.yml serve --watch --incremental", they codified everything inside docker-compose file
"If you have docker & docker-compose available there is no need to install any software stacks"
they use docker-compose just for test. So in a makefile they just invoke docker-compose build and docker-compose up for the testing
Docker quick start
Not clear why, but it seems that the only advantage here is to specify the volumes
Removed
docker-compose is ued for test. To run test, they just call "docker-compose up" from "package.json"
removed
"Add docker-compose.yml file to support local development"
An option ``to get homeautomation running'' instead of doing it manually
Simplify the command to start. Run "docker-compose up" instead of "docker run --name redis -d --restart=always  --publish 6379:6379 --volume /srv/docker/redis:/var/lib/redis sameersbn/redis:4.0.9-2"
"make the switch to docker for environment management"
to make it "easy to setup: there are docker images and docker-compose ready for use."

this project build an image for sending emails, the image is deployed on dockerhub. To test the image, they need to specify a certain environment variables. Instead of doing that on a command line, they have a docker-compose to easily declare these environement variables. On top of that, they use the compose for easier deployment
They use an image from dockerhub and tweak it with a specific command

A simple way to start the webiste "If you want to start the site with docker compose". The compose uses an existing image, and start it with a long command, which might not be trivial when using just a command line?
``added a docker compose for [easier] development". To run the databse, you need to simply run "docker-compose up". To stop the datbase, you need to simply run "docker-compose down"
they add support to docker-compose
It's used to setup the environment and to run  test suit
Removed
For easy installation. Either run "docker run -d -p 10086:10086 -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock tobegit3hub/seagull" or just "docker-compose up -d ."

Compose is removed
They use an official image, which they tweak by changing the port and adding certain environment variables
Compose is removed

An example of how difficult it is to understand the goal of adding docker-compose. They just indicate in the commit message the following: "Added docker-compose.yml."
The compose is used for testing
They use a dockerhub image and change its port
